results.justification: The document explicitly states the research aims to measure SRL processes using trace data and compares secondary and higher education students. The methodology is outlined in sections 3.1, 3.2, 3.3, 3.4, and 3.5.

Sections 3.1 through 3.5 provide a detailed, step-by-step description of the study design, including participant recruitment, data collection, data processing, SRL process modelling, and analysis techniques.
The document does not state that the raw or processed datasets are publicly available.
While there is no explicit statement about data sharing, the document does not provide a justification for why the data cannot be shared.
Section 3.2 details the survey questions, pretest formats, and essay scoring criteria, providing documentation of the data collected.
Data collection methods are fully described in section 3.2, including details about surveys, pretests, essay scoring, and trace data collection.

The document states: "This coding framework was validated by [13] (see Table 1). To apply the codes to the data we developed a trace parser...and maps them to corresponding SRL processes, as delineated in the coding scheme provided in a GitHub repository (https://github.com/yixin- cheng/lak25)."
Code is shared, so this criterion is not applicable.
The trace parser mentioned in the document is used for data preparation and is available on GitHub (https://github.com/yixin- cheng/lak25).
Statistical tests (regression analysis), models (M1, M2, M3), and assumptions are described in section 3.5.
Effect sizes (Cohen’s 𝑑), confidence intervals, and p-values are reported in Table 2 and the surrounding text.
The analysis is primarily quantitative. While interpretations are provided, there is limited subjective context beyond the statistical findings.
The document focuses on quantitative analysis and does not describe data coding or analysis in a qualitative manner.
Results are clearly presented in sections 4.1, 4.2, and 4.3, with reference to figures and tables.
Limitations are discussed at the end of the document, including task duration differences and the lack of examination of SRL processes at the level of specific learning strategies.
The document does not contain a link to a preregistration on the Open Science Foundation or any other platform.
